content.text:
# List of World War II aces from Germany: M–P

This is a list of fighter aces in World War II from Germany with their surname starting from M to P. A flying ace or fighter ace is a military aviator credited with shooting down five or more enemy aircraft during aerial combat. Aces are listed alphabetically by last name.
Aces
File:Bundesarchiv Bild 146-2006-0122, Hans-Joachim Marseille.jpg|Hans-Joachim Marseille, the highest scoring German ace over the Western Allies
File:Egon Mayer Portrait.jpg|Egon Mayer, claimed 26 heavy bombers shot down
File:Bundesarchiv Bild 183-L09694, Werner Mölders.jpg|Werner Mölders, the first pilot to claim 100 aerial victories
File:Joachim Müncheberg.jpg|Joachim Müncheberg, killed in North Africa
File:Walter Nowotny (portrait).jpg|Walter Nowotny, the first pilot to claim 250 aerial victories
File:Walter Oesau in Straubing (Mitterharthausen), ca. 1941 (2).jpg|Walter Oesau, the third pilot to claim 100 aerial victories
By surname:
A–F  G–L  Q–S  T–Z
